Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 2001: Start: 2024-04-01 09:00 End: 2024-04-01 10:30 Duration: 1 hour 30 minutes (90 mins). Case 2002: Start: 2024-04-01 09:05 End: 2024-04-02 11:00 Duration: 1 day + 1 hour 55 minutes (approx 26 hours).

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 2001: 90 mins. Case 2002: ~26 hours. Case 2003: ~48 hours. Case 2004: 85 mins. Case 2005: ~77 hours. Comparison: Cases 2001 and 2004 are Low complexity and finished in under 1.5 hours. Cases 2002 2003 and 2005 took over a day.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Complexity: Low (2001 2004): Fast. Medium (2002): Slower. High (2003 2005): Slowest. Observation: There is a strong positive correlation between Complexity and Duration.

Name: Pattern Recognition - IND
Text: Region: Region A: 2001 (Low): Fast. 2003 (High): Slow. Region B: 2004 (Low): Fast. 2002 (Medium): Slow. 2005 (High): Slowest. Observation: Both regions have fast cases and slow cases. Region alone isnt the primary driver.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: The Request Additional Documents Loop: Case 2001 (Low): 0 requests. Duration: 1.5 hrs. Case 2004 (Low): 0 requests. Duration: 1.4 hrs. Case 2002 (Medium): 1 request. Duration: ~26 hrs. Case 2003 (High): 2 requests. Duration: ~48 hrs. Case 2005 (High): 3 requests. Duration: ~77 hrs. Observation: Every Request Additional Documents activity introduces a massive delay.

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: No wait. Lets re-examine 2005 timeline: Apr 1 09:25 Submit Apr 1 09:50 Evaluate Apr 1 11:30 Request Docs 1 Apr 2 17:00 Request Docs 2 (Long gap here ~1.5 days) Apr 3 15:00 Request Docs 3 (Gap ~22 hours) Apr 4 10:00 Approve.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Root Cause 1: Complexity & Documentation Loops. Analysis: High complexity claims (2003 2005) require multiple iterations of requesting documents. Each request adds significant wait time. Explanation: The initial evaluation for high-complexity claims is insufficient leading to missing information being discovered piecemeal.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Root Cause 2: Resource/Manager Availability (Manager_Bill). Analysis: Manager_Bill handles the High Complexity cases (2003 2005). The time between the final document request and approval is significant. Root Cause 3: Adjuster Efficiency (Iterative Requests).

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Refine the Data Analysis: Case 2001: 1.5 hours. Case 2002: 26 hours. Case 2003: 48 hours 20 mins. Case 2004: 1.25 hours. Case 2005: 77 hours 5 mins. Average Low Complexity: ~1.4 hours. Medium Complexity: ~26 hours. High Complexity: Average ~62.5 hours. Direct correlation: More requests = longer duration.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Self-Correction during drafting: Ensure I dont just blame the customer for not sending docs. The log shows Request Additional Documents happening multiple times. The root cause from a process perspective is that the company (the Resource/Adjuster) didnt ask for everything at once or didnt verify completeness properly in the evaluation phase.
